title: Add structured workflow for adding APIs to SkiaSharp
body:
**Description of Change**

Created a skill-based architecture for adding C# APIs to SkiaSharp, eliminating duplication and establishing clear separation between execution workflows, quick reference, and comprehensive documentation.

**Changes:**

- **Created `.github/skills/add-api/SKILL.md`** — 6-phase structured workflow (analyze C++ → add C API → commit submodule → generate bindings → wrap in C# → test) with checkpoints preventing common mistakes (lost submodule commits, manual edits of generated files, skipped tests)

- **Optimized `.github/copilot-instructions.md`** — Reduced from 496 to 416 lines by replacing detailed workflows with summaries and links. Added `add-api` to skills table. Created "Working with Native Skia Submodule" and "Adding New APIs" sections as concise references pointing to the skill and comprehensive docs.

- **Enhanced `documentation/adding-apis.md`** — Added submodule git workflow section with step-by-step commands, expanded checklist from 3 to 5 phases, added common mistakes table.

**Architecture:** Three-tier system where skill provides structured execution, instructions provide quick reference, and documentation provides comprehensive guide. Follows pattern established by native-dependency-update and other skills.

**Bugs Fixed**

None.

**API Changes**

None.

**Behavioral Changes**

None.

**Required skia PR**

None.

**PR Checklist**

- [x] Has tests (if omitted, state reason in description) — Documentation only
- [ ] Rebased on top of main at time of PR
- [ ] Merged related skia PRs
- [x] Changes adhere to coding standard
- [x] Updated documentation
